newsitem.title: CHINA: China state-owned assets $794 billion at end-1996.
newsitem.headline: China state-owned assets $794 billion at end-1996.

text.p: China had combined state-owned assets of 6,589 billion yuan ($794 billion) at the end of 1996, up 15.4 percent from the previous year, the Xinhua news agency said on Tuesday.

Productive state-owned assets totalled more than 4,993 billion yuan, accounting for 75.8 percent of the total, while non-productive assets were 1,595 billion yuan, making up the remaining 24.2 percent, Xinhua said, quoting official figures.
The assets of basic sectors -- posts and telecommunications, power generation, railway transportation and petroleum -- accounted for 28.1 percent of the total, it said.

Large and medium-sized state-owned enterprises, which account for 19.9 percent of the number of state-owned enterprises, had combined assets of more than 8,923 billion yuan, Xinhua said. It gave no further details.
